Package com.message.security

Class Encrypt

java.lang.Object
com.message.security.Encrypt
public final class Encrypt extends Object
The Encrypt class contains several useful class fields and methods. It can be instantiated in two ways. The facility provided by the Encrypt class is encrypt a String with a keypair. It uses another class Utility for basic encrypting operations. All the class fields and methods are either private or protected except the constructor and encrypt() method. Use the Decrypt class from com.message.security package to decrypt.

The encryption system uses 2 types of keypair (also called, factors)- Default keypair and User-defined keypair. Default keypair is set randomly by system and User-defined keypair is set by the user and remain constant. If an object is instantiated like this : 
     Encrypt e = new Encrypt();
Then this object will encrypt with default keypair which changes randomly every time the program starts. And if, an object is instantiated like this: 
     Encrypt e = new Encrypt(key1, key2);
Where key1 and key2 are bounded integers, then that object will encrypt with user defined keypair and the keys are {key1, key2}.
Author:
tinykishore
See Also:
Utility, Decrypt

  • Constructor Details

    • Encrypt

      public Encrypt()
      Internal constructor for default encryption keypair. Call this constructor when using Default keypair. Instantiating with this constructor will set the following attributes of object. 
            state               -   USER_DEFINED
      defaultFactorOne    -   Utility.generateRandomKeyOne();
      defaultFactorTwo    -   Utility.generateRandomKeyOne();
      factorOne           -   0   (INTEGER)
      factorTwo           -   0   (INTEGER)
      This class uses Utility class to generate a random number within a defined range
      See Also:
      Utility.generateRandomKeyOne(), Utility.generateRandomKeyTwo()

    • Encrypt

      public Encrypt​(int userKeyOne, int userKeyTwo) throws KeyPairNumberOutOfBounds
      Internal constructor for user defined encryption keypair. Call this constructor when using User Defined keypair. Instantiating with this constructor will set the following attributes of object. 
            state               -   USER_DEFINED
      this.userKeyOne     -   userKeyOne
      this.userKeyTwo     -   userKeyTwo
      defaultFactorOne    -   0   (INTEGER)
      defaultFactorTwo    -   0   (INTEGER)
      Parameters:
      userKeyOne - User Defined Key 1
      userKeyTwo - User Defined Key 2
      Throws:
      KeyPairNumberOutOfBounds - When exceed range

    • toKeyString

      @Deprecated protected String toKeyString()
      Deprecated.
      Returns the Keypair of current encrypt object as a String only if the state is : DEFAULT. Otherwise, returns null.
      Returns:
      Keypair as a String

    • encrypt

      public String encrypt​(String message)
      This method is for encrypting a String. Calls encryptSystem(String) for encrypting.
      Parameters:
      message - The String that is to be encrypted
      Returns:
      Encrypted message.
